title: How to Grill Cornish Game Hens with Gremolata

steps.headline: Butterfly Cornish game hens by removing the backbone using a pair of kitchen scissors.
steps.description: You can also have your butcher do this.

steps.headline: Marinate game hens using minced garlic and 2 juiced lemons plus their zest.
Oil the grill.
Heat grill.
Place the poultry on the grill and cook about 8 minutes per side.
Use a weight to promote even cooking and crispy skin.
steps.description: You can use a cooking weight or a heavy brick wrapped in aluminum foil.

steps.headline: Flip the Cornish game hens.
Cover with grill weight.
Remove game hens from the grill and allow to rest at least 5 to 10 minutes.
Stir the Gremolata.
Place the cooked game hen on a serving plate and top with some of the Gremolata.
Pour remaining Gremolata into a small bowl or ramekin.
Add the lemon zest to a blender container.
Add the coarsely chopped garlic to a blender container.
Add the juice from the 2 lemons.
Add the parsley.
Add salt to taste.
Add 2 to 3 tablespoons olive oil.
Blend the ingredients.
steps.description: Be careful to not over blend the Gremolata. The Gremolata should have a chunky rustic look.

steps.headline: Pour the Gremolata into the bowl.

text: Game Hens Butterfly Cornish game hens by removing the backbone using a pair of kitchen scissors. You can also have your butcher do this. Marinate game hens using minced garlic and 2 juiced lemons plus their zest.  Oil the grill.  Heat grill.  Place the poultry on the grill and cook about 8 minutes per side.  Use a weight to promote even cooking and crispy skin. You can use a cooking weight or a heavy brick wrapped in aluminum foil. Flip the Cornish game hens.  Cover with grill weight.  Remove game hens from the grill and allow to rest at least 5 to 10 minutes.  Stir the Gremolata.  Place the cooked game hen on a serving plate and top with some of the Gremolata.  Pour remaining Gremolata into a small bowl or ramekin.  Gremolata Add the lemon zest to a blender container.  Add the coarsely chopped garlic to a blender container.  Add the juice from the 2 lemons.  Add the parsley.  Add salt to taste.  Add 2 to 3 tablespoons olive oil.  Blend the ingredients. Be careful to not over blend the Gremolata. The Gremolata should have a chunky rustic look. Pour the Gremolata into the bowl.
